Package net.xpkgclient.exceptions

Class XPkgArgLenException

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Throwable
java.lang.Exception
net.xpkgclient.exceptions.XPkgException
net.xpkgclient.exceptions.XPkgScriptRunnerException
net.xpkgclient.exceptions.XPkgParseException
net.xpkgclient.exceptions.XPkgArgLenException
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, ILineException<XPkgParseException>
public class XPkgArgLenException extends XPkgParseException
Thrown when a command expects a certain amount of arguments, but either gets too many or too few.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    XPkgArgLenException(CommandName cmd, int given)
    Constructor which is used to throw when a command expects no arguments, but is given some anyway.
    XPkgArgLenException(CommandName cmd, int expected, int actual)
    Constructor which is used to throw when a command expects a fixed amount of arguments.
    XPkgArgLenException(CommandName cmd, int max, String reason)
    Constructor which is used to throw when a command expects a maximum amount of arguments for a certain reason.

  • Constructor Details

    • XPkgArgLenException

      public XPkgArgLenException(CommandName cmd, int expected, int actual)
      Constructor which is used to throw when a command expects a fixed amount of arguments.
      Parameters:
      cmd - The command that threw the exception.
      expected - The expected amount of arguments.
      actual - The amount of arguments the command had.

    • XPkgArgLenException

      public XPkgArgLenException(CommandName cmd, int max, String reason)
      Constructor which is used to throw when a command expects a maximum amount of arguments for a certain reason.
      Parameters:
      cmd - The command that threw the exception.
      max - The maximum amount of arguments for the given reason.
      reason - In what scenario the command expects the maximum (prepended with "if ").

    • XPkgArgLenException

      public XPkgArgLenException(CommandName cmd, int given)
      Constructor which is used to throw when a command expects no arguments, but is given some anyway.
      Parameters:
      cmd - The command that threw the exception.
      given - The amount of arguments that were given to the command.
